page.title: 14Education,Coads Green School
page.content: The land was bought to build an {Ebenezer Chapel}in{1826}for Â£1.50. This Methodist chapel was built on to make a{Methodist Day School}which was opened in{1869}.The original chapel being no longer needed as a larger more splendid chapel was built next to the Ebenezer Chapel.In {1912}Cornwall County Council took over the running of the school and leased the buildings for{Â£6}a year.The current rent is still under{Â£30.} In July{1985}the school had{60 pupils {and 2 teachers.}In September there will be{3 teachers.}During the summer of 1985 the roof was taken off and replaced and the inside remodelled to cater for three classrooms for the first time.The school uses tha village hall for assemblies and games and an adjoining field leased from the chapel by the Parish Council football etc.
